title: Tax Resolution Attorney John P. Willis Tells Taxpayers the IRS Has Given Some Unintended Tax Relief
text:
Tax resolution attorney John Willis, CEO and founder of IRSALLSTAR.com writes about the current low levels of IRS audits and tells how the levels are continuing to drop as a result of IRS budget cuts, offering some relief to taxpayers who fear being audited.
Fairhope, AL, July 30, 2015 : Tax Attorney John Willis, CEO and founder of IRSALLSTAR.com, recently posted a new article on his website entitled “Relax, Your Chances of Being Audited by the IRS Have Never Been Lower.” The IRS may not see things the same way Attorney Willis does.
Willis concedes “I know, I know, the word “relax” is not one you usually hear uttered at tax time.” He acknowledges, “This is without question one of the most stressful times for tax paying Americans. However, things are a little different this year. Amid the scams and lack of IRS resources, you can breath a little easier because your chances of being audited have dropped to record lows.”
The lowest audit rates in a decade may give some taxpayers cause for celebration. Willis turns to U.S.A. Today for recent statistics, “According to some recent data U.S.A. Today obtained from the IRS, “Your chances of facing an IRS audit rate dropped to the lowest level in at least a decade in 2014 and are expected to fall further this year.”
Willis adds, “Anyone who has ever been audited probably doesn’t give a hoot as to what has caused the decline. As I mentioned before, one cause is the lack of resources, which U.S.A. Today confirms. “The audit declines coincide with recent drops in IRS funding and a steady falloff in revenue agents.”
The entire article can be read at: http://www.irsallstar.com/articles/relax-your-chances-of-being-audited-by-the-irs-have-never-been-lower.php
